column3: Wonderful hotel close to many things
column4: We stayed as a family for 3 nights on the Tangier part of our Moroccan vacation. This hotel was across from the train station and Tangier city mall and a block or so south of the main Tangier beach and boardwalk, so easy walking distance (1/2 hr or so in either direction) of the marina and Malabata area. Room was very comfy and modern, nice size pull out bed for our daughter. Nespresso and water in room free of charge. Breakfast was good, lots of variety. Front desk arranged a tour for us with a guide, which was fantastic and hit all the sights we wanted to see. The bar could’ve been a bit better, but we were able to get a cold beer and a glass of wine. Overall a great hotel!

The worst experience ever. Instead of 1.5 hours massage I received only 30min massage. Reception cannot speak English, I ended up waiting at the reception for my friend who received 1.5 hours massage there. Instead of relaxing evening I had the worst time ever arguing and waiting for my friend. They offered another 1 hour massage but the therapist looked like she was about to cry when we went to the room. I didn’t want a massage from someone who was very unhappy and unprofessional. The whole experience was extremely tiring.

column3: Spa recommendation, special thanks to Dina and Asmaa
column4: I went to the Spa center of Royal Tulip and i must say the indoor pool is the best in Tangier And a special thanks to Dina & Asmaa who welcomed me , they are so kind and generous, the water’s temperatures was 29c which is so warm, which i loved about this spa

column3: Not sure how this can possibly be a 5* hotel
column4: I must admit that I am surprised with the vast majority of reviews on here that are giving the Royal Tulip City Center Hotel 5 stars. There is simply no comparison between this hotel and true 5 star hotels. There is nothing remotely outstanding or memorable about the Royal Tulip. The location is good; it's near the main train station of Tangier, as well as the Medina area. I think there is a shopping centre nearby. It's just off a main road where taxis are easily available. Check in staff were pleasant, but nothing special. The room was fine, but not thoroughly cleaned when we first entered. The curtains were somewhat dirty and so was the carpet in some areas. The size of the TV was tiny compared to the size of the wall. The main issue I had was with the shower bath. The water…

column3: Beautiful Tangier, a bridge between Africa and Europe ..
column4: My son and I arrived from Casablanca before sunset, I did not stand long in front of the reception, the professionalism of the employee who occupied me with opening a dialogue in the name with me until he handed me room cards, the hotel was crowded with citizens coming to visit from Europe, you need to stand long to reach your room, the rooms are large and clean with Romantic balcony view, conducive to relaxation and meditation, comfortable bed, delicious full breakfast and staff waiting to fulfill your requests, surprising they could not remove a dark stain on the flooring!

column3: The hotel staff were courteous, helpful and charming in dealing with us. The beautiful reception staff were very helpful
column4: We spent a long weekend in Tangier staying at this hotel. The facilities were excellent. Food was good and location was ideal for us, as it was central. I cannot praise the young beautiful ladies at reception enough for all the help and assistance given to us and always with a happy smile.

I stay 2 days in royal tulip it's a good hotel and the staff also very good especially Ananthu,Jayakansar thanks them for good serice. I recomment everyone to stay here. The food was awesome brekfast will visit again

Amazing experience, the staff were extremely nice and helpful. If you go ask for Lina or Asmae, they managed to accommodate me last minute and this is definitely my go to spa place whenever I am next in Tangier. Would highly recommend to friends and family.

This was the beat breakfast in all the City with a great selection and only 100 diram Great coffee and great selection of teas and even fresh mint Muhammad was the main dining room attendent and he was so kind and thoughtful. He is the diamond at the hotel and took plates away and was so thoughtful and kind and really made breakfast so enjoyable and went out of his way to make all perfect!!!

This hotel is quite honestly one of the best hotels that I've stayed in. The rooms are beautiful and spacious, the views are to die for and most importantly the staff are very kind, helpful and polite. Naoufal specifically went above and beyond his duty and was helpful in every way possible. He is a true asset to Royal Tulip and an amazing gentleman. Special thanks also to Hasnae and Lina at the spa. My daughter and I had an amazing afternoon there. So polite, helpful and friendly. Until next time :) Darifa

I’m Marco , Italian property entrepreneur london based, I ve been 1 week in Marocco travelling looking for new properties investment , but unfortunately they close out and in flight so I must to spent extra 10 days around While I’ve been driving for 18 days all over the country, I must get hotel wherever I stopped I was looking for a better place in tangier cause first experience in others hotel was not happy at all Searching in booking . Com I found royal tulip city centre Luxury hotel but with very reasonable price, so strait away I booked I received a very good welcoming as soon I check in, people given with big smile very good help from the parking , receptioning, till luggages brought it in the room, after a very good comfortable sleep I woke up so fresh and I walk strait…

Great hotel, nice location, Amazing staff, and so professional services. It was so so clean rooms, quiet and good room size. The breakfast was awesome, fast service not crowded and helpful staff. I would like to thank Mr. Hussain in reception he was excellent and help us.

This is your typically business hotel. Something you company would book if you had a short business trip. I would not call this hotel a 5 star. This is a 3 star by all standards. The price of course reflects this. If you are staying in the city a couple night then it’s okay but I couldn’t spend a week here. Staff is friendly, decently clean and breakfast was okay. Otherwise, a three star experience.

From the first moment you enter the hotel until your departure, you are not only a guest, but the master of the house. The hotel and facilities are first class and constantly maintained. The interior is a very chic design, everything seems to be coordinated. The spa and wellness area is just world class, a great atmosphere for sauna, hammam and your wellness :) The rooms are equipped with all comforts, and for little surprises the friendly polite and courteous staff is always around. A perfect team that is second to none. Reception, lounge, restaurant and especially the breakfast buffet. Simply a dream. You have the feeling of individual care by professional staff, who read your every wish from your eyes. Pure luxury. This rating goes to the entire staff, which was unanimously…

I would give 0 if I could! Absolutely disgusting.. first room was promised with sea view got placed infront of noisy main road! It was dirty mouldy bathroom and broken dirty fridge. Went to speak to the staff lying and rude saying they were full, as soon as we say we want a refund they found us "magically " a "better " room! Managed to get another room after arguing about it for ages .. and then the worst thing happened to my husband, he got stuck in the lift with no oxygen for more than 40 min until someone came to help.. if it wasn't for my parents in law and other room guests my husband would have died in that lift. Even the rooms telephone had no signal so there was no way to call for help! No one came to help! And then as an apology they offered food for free! And made…

very ggod hotel in the city center, where a car is not really needed. the rooms space is great, clear, and comfortable. The breakfast is good too. for negative points, I feel the hotel quite crowded and under staffed, with a need to wait to be serviced sometimes. In overall, we had a good stay.

I will be very objective in my feedback, I have made several hotels in Morocco of different categories. I spent three nights at the Royal Tulipe and it does not deserve its 5 stars, it is at most a 3 stars. the quality of service is very low. the food is cheap. the room service is very bad, the reception is not professional. the breakfast which is included in the stay is of very poor quality, you can eat in a cafe better than that. the hotel is soundproofed there is traffic and there is noise from outside. the wifi is very bad I had to work on my data. It is a pity that a hotel to be well located is to degrade that its level of reception, rooms, catering. the hotel is expensive compared to the other hotel whose quality is 10 times better

Houssaine the Concierge and Mohammed the bellhop were just outstanding in their helpfulness and kindness. I had a great view with a balcony overlooking the ocean. The room was spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was modern. The gym was quite large and they had fun classes. I enjoyed my massage, along with the pool and sauna (they could be a little quieter in the spa area as there were staffs taking loudly outside my massage room for half the massage). Breakfast was plentiful, and they made efforts to provide me with Vegan options. Houssaine even sent me up lovely flowers and a fruit platter. I'll definitely be back!

I was there in january with my husband. We’ve booked 5 days. First we had a normal room. After a problem they did not only gived us a suite, but they also sent us flowers and a really sweet letter ( i think here name was hajar who wrote the letter) i also really want to thank Saad, he called us a 3 or 4 times to make Sure everyting is fine.believe me, i went to a lot of hotels in tanger, but this is the best. They really listen to the visiters and do the best they can to make sure you enjoy your stay. At The breakfast you have a lot to choose.

I was planning to stay just two nights in this hotel. It was ended to be four nights. Location is the best in Tangier. Breakfast was amazing. When it comes to staff they were the best part of my stay. Mr. Yassir is one of the most enthusiastic and supportive hoteliers i have ever met. He gave me precious advices to discover Tangier the best. Mr. Ahmed & Mr. El-Hassan were very nice and professional. Highly recommended hotel for all types of travellers.

We were making our way north from Marrakech eventually leaving to Spain from Tangier. We stumbled upon the Royal Tulip City Center because it was near the train station. Our intent was to stay one night and search for other hotels in the area; we ended staying at the Royal Tulip all three nights. We were in a large comfortable room on a higher floor with views of the mountains. Since we wanted to travel to Chefchaouen, Hajar at the front desk arranged a driver for a day trip there. She was charming and beautiful and loved practicing her English with my wife. She seemed genuinely excited when my wife asked to extend our stay. All of the staff was wonderful. Hussein, the evening desk clerk, made sure we had transportation to the Tangier-Med port when our ferry from Tangier-Ville…

A great hotel with extremely friendly staff. Very generous and welcoming. Especially Mr. Hussein. I highly Recommend this facility and it is definitely worthy. Located in a great spot near the see and many cafés.

We stayed for two nights--and, that's one night too many to stay in Fez. We took a taxi from the airport to the hotel and made the mistake of not deciding on a price before they took us. Upon getting out of the taxi, we tried to settle the bill, and the driver tried to pull one on us, but the concierge helped us with setting things straight. So that was nice. We got in around 21:00 or so and were only given Moroccan tea on our arrival (some people have said a snack, too?--we didn't get any and were super hungry.) Check-in was simple. Bell hop took our suitcases to the room. Our room was HUGE and HOT. This is December, why in the world is it so hot in the room? Glad that we could open the patio door. We kept it open all stay. The AC wouldn't work. Our bed was comfortable and…

We spent four nights at this hotel over the New Year's period and bought tickets for the hotel's New Year's Eve dinner and party. What a disaster! After asking several times when they would begin serving the dinner for New Years, I was told 9:00 PM. We arrived at 9:20PM, hoping we wouldn't be too late or too early. We were too early by three hours as it turned out. We sat down and after an hour we were presented with a chocolate bon bon. Weird. Then about 30 minutes after that we were presented with a martini glass half-filled with a cold seafood bisque. No spoon, you just had to find a way to gulp it down. It got to be around 11:30PM with no other food presented to us, and we had gone through several stages of denial, anger, acceptance to the whole nightmare, when they…

PROS: - Top design with spacious and modern lobby - The view of the waterfront was amazing, in the morning hours we could see clearly the Spanish coast of another continent - The attached gym has its own building and two additional class rooms (spinning and yoga), fantastic Tchnogym equipments - Perfect breakfast buffet with everything we wanted - Superb service —> highly recommend!!!

I have stayed only 2 nights , the breakfast was great but the dinner need some improvement to have more variety like rice and macaroni The reception was really nice but my room was city view which was little bit boring

I had the pleasure to be guest in Royal Tulip, Tangier, Morocco. I will use this hotel again next time, higly recommand. Thanks to Ms. Hiba i have a new understanding of Hospitality management, Manner, Professionalisym and taking royal care of the customer! Please Thank your employees for their hard work and consider, without them this can be quite ordinary hotel.

column3: Best hotel we had in Morocco!
column4: Great hotel - spacious room, very clean and nicely designed. We stayed with a group. Breakfast was plentiful and versatile - very tasty! Great location! Very good service, friendly staff. We spent 10 days in Morocco - this was our best hotel in Morocco! Highly recommended.

We very very much enjoyed our stay at Tulip hotel. We were very warmly greeted with delicious mint tea and pastries and helped out with our lugagge. The staff are great, big congrats for the attentive and helpful staff ! Location is excellent! We felt so good! The room was perfect, the view amazing, the breakfast so delicious. We loved our stay, will definitely return!

column3: Beautiful hotel with an amazing staff on our first time to Morocco
column4: This is our first time to Morocco and we could not have been more impressed. The hotel had luxury accommodations and was very clean. The staff was very kind, generous , and gracious. They were very eager and willing to help us. Reception helped us the most; we asked for recommendations regarding restaurants and sights around Tangier and we’re not disappointed!. They called us taxis whenever we needed and even changed our currency for us. Meryem ,one of the receptionists,was a huge help to us. She was so kind and helpful, and answered every question we had. You can easily tell she is passionate about her work and was eager to help. The food was excellent and room service was easy and quick. Wassima was also a very helpful receptionist and helped us feel at ease and excited for…

I stayed in this hotel on a 9 day business trip to Tangier. I found the accommodation to be neat and tidy, with all of the services I needed. There are two main restaurants. One is a buffet at a fixed price and the second is an al la carte restaurant. The buffet is excellent with a wide range of starters, entrees and deserts. However, the coffee machine is not available. Vasco, the al la carte restaurant is excellent also , with a good choice of fish or meat. On a slight downside, I found the room cleaning service a little lacking. As:- - Carpet not vacuumed daily - Used bathroom items not removed. - Only one sachet of Nescafé left daily, which is a little mean! - No coffee whitener/ milk sachets to accompany room coffee. There’s also a bar which specialises in…

column3: Great Experience, a true 5* in Tangier
column4: Nice experience. Smooth check-in process, welcome drinks. A special thank you to Saad Boumraya, the Rooms Division Director, for it's warm welcome and for upgrading one of our rooms to a Suite, we were a family of 4, so it couldn't be more timely. Rooms are clean, cozy and spacious. Staff in general was nice and ready to help at any time. Easy check out. Great service all around. This will definitely be my go to Hotel any time I am in Tangier. Thank you !

The staff was very friendly. From the receptionist to the poolside waitress, we received friendly and helpful service. The room was clean. The amenities were nice. We enjoyed massages at the spa. Breakfast was ok. The music at the pool was very loud, and although there were primarily families at the pool, the music was very inappropriate. Not only was it filled with curse words, but it was also very explicitly sexual and raunchy. At dinner, it was a bit difficult to enjoy the meal because of the little children running around the restaurant without any supervision.

The location is centrally located, the room was very clean, and the staff were friendly and courteous! Additionally, the breakfast was out of this world, one of the best hotel breakfasts I've ever had and I've stayed at a lot of hotels! I highly recommend staying at this hotel.

We booked one week in this hotel, It was an enjoyable stay, perfect location, room was clean, big with comfortable beds & nice balcony, the staff were so kind, the receptionist Yessir, restaurant manager Noufel, smiley waiter Ismail, lifeguard Sofian & housekeeping lady who kept our room to high standard every day, leaving chocolate & flowers in our room made us feel special. Hotel downside, it should have more variation in fruits especially when you are in country like morocco, music was little bit loud afternoon & should include more kids channels. Overall the experience was brilliant as family, we will definitely would stay there again & recommend it to family & friends.

I stayed here for 4 nights in June and have to say the hotel is absolutely fantastic, food was beautiful, pool was great, all the staff were brilliant. We ate in the al a Carte restaurant one night and the food was out of this world , would definitely recommend it. The staff were really good if you needed anything and always there at your beckoned call. I can also recommend the brandy and cigar bar, it has a great relaxed feel to it and the drinks are reasonably priced with a great selection. I think I will be back soon on another business trip and will definitely book into this hotel again. Fantastic place

The staff were fantastic, highly professional and welcoming from reception check in to the house crews. The room was lovely and very comfortable, spacious, bright and with a balcony to 'people spot' from. Plenty of coffee/tea in the room and bathroom complimentary toiletries too. Shortly after my check in, the floor manager checked that everything was to my satisfaction. I don't know who was more surprised? Either me about being asked or the floor manager finding me in my jammies mid-afternoon. I didn't eat in the restaurant that evening, however went down to breakfast by 0815 ( early by my standards!) the next morning and found the buffet a bit lacking as they had obviously been very busy before I got there. That said, the waiting staff were tremendous and made sure that I…

We stayed last week 4 nights in this lovely hotel. De staff was very kind, especially two of them, unfortunately i don’t remember their names. One was a man who was working there at the 2nd of June in the morning, and the other one was a girl who was working the 30th of May. This girl gave me so many good advices for places to visit. The staff at the breakfast room was very kind too. The room was very clean and the view was great. We had an upgrade, what we loved of course:) Two points of critic; There was a misunderstanding about the dinner. I thought dinner was 340 dirham for two person (one adult one child) but it was for one person. That’s very expensive, especially when one of us is a child and the other one vegetarian. But they solved it very slightly. So thank you for…

column3: Not 5 star hotel reception/restaurant - Reception et restaurantes pas au nivex d'un 5 etoiles
column4: Positive: + Room with balcony Negative: - Reception/Conciarge: The reception is not good in turist advices and it is practically absent in any assistence after sales. - Restaurants: There is only one restaurant in the evening and the service is very slow. - Swimming pool

First 5 star hotel where we got stolen our money! We were three girls travelling from Spain and booked a room from May 4 to May 5. First even though there is indoor pool at the hotel, you have to pay in order to use it! So we paid and entered and put our bags in lockers . After being in swimming pool and massage (also paid) we took our bag and only in the evening during dinner found out that there is no cash left in the bag. As it was hidden in the wallet under bills from shops it could not fall. After we went to check the room if everything is ok, we realized that from a bag of one money has also disappeared. We went to the reception to ask about the clarification for which they said it is issue of spa department and we should come here in the morning. Ok we waited the morning…

i went to this fancy hotel, my friends and i to enjoy a tea corner that they have ( el momento ) , my 2 other friends slept in the hotel and they find it very nice , it’s a new hotel where the food is delicious and the personals are professional & kind !i highly recommend it.

Located in the Royal Tulip is a piano lounge called X.O Bar. Naoufel and Mohamed Guenouni made our night caps pleasant as we listened to the amazing piano player. The hotel is very nice but this was the icing.

I spent two night in this great hotel with very professional staff. The service was fantastic, the facilities are clean and room is very convenient. The hotel is situated in a very touristic area, walking distance to the beach and a mall. As the parking space is limited, we came late in the evening but the staff took care of the car. The breakfast buffet is awesome with variety of Moroccan food. I recommend this hotel.

I have stayed in Tangier many times in other hotels and areas. This was my first stay in this one and in this area. No regrets whatsoever, on the contrary, i'll be back. Nice staff, large comfortable rooms, incredible breakfast, good hammam... Everything to make your stay an enjoyable experience is there.

I loved this hotel. Centrally located in the city centre and close to malls, the corniche, restaurants, cafes and the train station. Tangier now is only 2 hours from Casablanca by LGV (high-speed train). The room is very nice and staff are friendly. All rooms have balcony.

The Royal Tulip is situated very close to the train station and mall. The rooms are beautiful, clean and the hotel provides free breakfast. Best of all is the staff--specifically Sabrine and Ahmad. They helped us get acquainted, gave us restaurant recommendations, booked tours for us and were just so friendly and pleasant. I can't say enough about how great the staff is.

column3: Disappointed walk-in, management made it up to me
column4: I'm a regular here and have previously left a glowing review. Disappointed last night to arrive as a walk-in at 8pm and being quoted the same price as any other customer, despite clearly signaling I'm a frequent customer. Complained on TripAdvisor and directly to management the next morning and I received the apologies I wanted and a complementary upgrade. The management, specifically Mehdi, was very attentive and responsive to my complaints, which is ultimately the best one can expect. I still recommend the hotel.

I had the best experience in Royal Tulip Tangier. At the check-in they gave me a free upgrade to a see view room. Whenever I called the reception they were always available and friendly. I totally recommand this hotel for its staff and luxury sercices.

column3: Very good hotel, close to railway station
column4: Very good hotel, close to railway station. Good amenities (restaurants, bars, wifi/internet, concierge service). Rather calm, not too far from city center and medina. Large choice of food and wines. Taxi service on request.

May be you find it a little strange that someone is reviewing a hotel that they have not visited yet. Well, I can tell you that my family went to this hotel when it was inaugurated back in the day. When my sister told me she has a conference there, I did not hesitate to decide to come and spend few days at the hotel and also visit with my sister. So, from Toronto Canada, I will God willing come to a hotel who impressed my family who are all travellers and know about hotels; and always stay in this hotel for the quality of the staff who are hired, the quality of the service which is being offered. I am looking forward to it.

column3: words can hardly express how much I love this hotel
column4: Difficult to express in words how much I enjoyed this wonderful hotel! Had a lovely 4 nights stay, all was more than perfect from the moment of check-in (big thanks to Mohamed) till I left. The luxe suite with sea view was very spacious en spotless clean, so was the entire hotel. Great sleeping comfort. Breakfast was very varied, all fresh and tasty, a beautiful start of the day. The entire staff is very friendly and professional. Well worth the 5 stars. Very good location close to the train station and shopping mall, quiet and safe area. Am solo female traveler, felt very safe. Even though I love the charmes of the medina I was every evening happy to return to the comfort of this luxurious hotel. Thank you!

column3: for us best experience of Marokkean Hotels...
column4: jumping over by ferry from Algeciras this was our first stay in Marokko - on our selfdrive discovery experience ! And actually after all, it was the best in super quality and ok-pricing. We consider this hotel on a good spanish level, super quality room, very nice Bell-captain Ahmed ( he was excellent and charming - super guy - ready for more in this business, I would believe)... we got nice "walk-in-rate" from flexible front-desk lady and had a balcony nice room - view to swimming pool and beach - breakfast for marokkean hotel standard extra-ordinary ! Tapas in 1st floor restaurant really excellent..... very nice all over and to recommend - try to get best rate, as in this country everything is negotiable ;)!!

Let me say briefly; Stayed here more than 1 month. Therefore my feedback would not based on my feeling only but also my observations. First of all I want to thank Mr Saad Boumraya to have such a high motivated and friendly team. Especially to Kaoutar and Lina at reception. Many days I saw that hotel was full , where I didn't expect so much. Breakfasts provide large variety. Cleanliness of rooms and common areas are also in high standards. It is located near to coast in the city center.

column3: *DO NOT USE THEIR LAUNDRY SERVICE, IT WAS A SCAM*
column4: I asked the hotel if laundry service was available, they sent staff right away to pick my up clothes, they listed each item and then had me sign. The next day my clothes were delivered with a receipt that didn't mention price just the list of clothes with my signature from the day before. When I checked out of the hotel, I noticed a laundry bill of 1625 MMD, which is about $170 USD!!! Very surprising that they would overcharge like that, it felt like a scam. Other than the laundry, this is a nice hotel with a good location, restaurant, and pool.

My friends came for my wedding so I was staying with them from time to time in their hotel while I was getting ready. They complained since they were there longer than i was, that the service wasnt good that they asked for things hours before and didnt get them fast(this is what they said) I on the other hand had a great experience I booked this hotel the night of my wedding as my room was cancelled in another hotel. Once I was checking in I saw the Barcelona team which was playing in town that week come in(maybe that's why the service was a bit slow, mind you it was August peak season) anyway back to the story. Checked in told them it was my wedding night and the manager upgraded me to a suite. Which was just gorgeous and the service the next morning was quick and fast for…

I book massage and hammam The receptionist Lamia was very helpful and smaily The hammam man Abdullah was excellent I definitely recommend this spa and I will visit it again It worth every penny Thanks

the service was very beautiful in the hotel, stuff very active and ambitious, specially guest relations they were very supportive and even drew an itinerary for us to visit the city, assured transportation and reserved restaurants for us the stay was amazing i totally recommend it

I’m at the hotel ATM, while I’m writing my review. This place is one of the best in Tangier, well located 2 Min from Tangier central train station, close to the beach. Beautiful sophisticated design. Lovely professional staff. The food we had the was a bit boring and less than what I’m used to it in this hotel. Could have been better !

This hotel is simply incredible, they welcome you with Moroccan tea and cookies, the bed was one of the most comfy beds i've experienced, the breakfast is just TOP. Their services are amazing. Loved it and can't wait to be back.

column3: Closest you can get to 5 star
column4: Very much enjoyed staying at this hotel. Stay was not perfect, but every issue was dealt with quickly and in an efficient manner. As usual staff lacks training and facilities lack inspection so it is up to the client to report things, but that is usually the case in Morocco (unfortunately). Very good location. Excellent breakfast. Very nice staff (except for SOME of the ladies who need to realize smiling is absolutely necessary when working in a hotel of this level). Would stay here again.

Hotel is overcrowded. Staff is inefficient. Breakfast and diner is a nightmarre. Room service is absolutely unprofessional. And the sport area is more a discotheque than a place where you practise peacfully ! The best is that they do not even propose a towel for the sport. You have to bring your own... To be avoided. Ah yes .. the best is that there are some ongoing work next to the hotels and workers finished at 23:00 and start at 6:00... great!

We went there with my parents for a night. Travelling around Morocco. From the beginning I wasn't satisfied at all but at the end I have to recognize the staff (all services housekeepers waiters and receptionists) and managers professionalism. A special thanks from my parents and I to two ladies not sure about their name oumaima and khaoutar you're tip top. Great location, rooms ok. Hope to see ya guys next year insha ALLAH Sophie Sophie

i Booked online, no payment until i got there. Reception service was excellent, especially from a young lady named Koupter. She made our stay extra special and extra comfortable. The hotel itself is in a good location, close to everything. Do not miss breakfast, it is fantastic!

column3: Best stay in a hotel in Morocco
column4: Stayed here three times in total, and each time, they do better than last time we stay there. We are always pampered in a very luxurious way. Breakfast buffet was the highlight of our stays because it had so many choices... Rooms are spacious and very clean. So calm... definitely staying there soon.

column3: Business in Tangier - Hotel not too far from the Tangier sea and harbour promenade.
column4: Spacious rooms with good beds, big bathrooms and balcony. Very good cleanliness. Excellent breakfast with wide range of food. Excellent services including pools, massage. 2 restaurants, bars, large fitness.

This Hotel is great. Large rooms, king size beds, cleaning is excellent, large bathroom with all you need. Breakfast is Top. You have a huge variety of food, and quality is excellent. Hotel personnel are very professional and are always looking to see what you may need. This is really worthing the price, well placed, near a shopping mall if you want to check local shops. I strongly recommend this Hotel as one of the best choices for a short stay in Tanger.

Stayed just one night while visiting the city for some working assignment and I found this property to be a great choice. Rooms are spacious and well appointed. Wifi speed was fair enough and the breakfast was really great with so many choices. Overall it was a very good stay an if I have to come back to Tanger this will be clearly my best choice.

This hotel is really a great choice! Everything is modern and perfectly clean. My king size bed was very comfortable and gave me a good sleep. Most amenities were perfectly working, but only the WiFi, which is free, was a bit slow at times. Cleaning staff use a fresh room fragrance which I liked very much. The wall of the room as well as the floors are decorated with old photos of Tangier or some nice pieces of art that show parts of the city. The concierge desk is a very good place to get some ideas about what to do and how that can be organised. Thank you. The breakfast buffet was just good. Everything one would expect from a buffet in an international hotel was available, but nothing more. The staff is very mixed: some members are really nice, helpful and up for a little…

My room was clean, spacious, and modern. The wifi is great, the shower water pressure is great, the towels are decent (but not great). Sara at Guest relations was super helpful when I had a tech issue and with advice on where to eat. I can't comment on breakfast because I ate a traditional Tanger café down the road. I recommend.

This hotel is very nice , clean and the staff is very helpful . Saad is a great person in the right place to welcome and put guests at ease. Restaurant has very nice food and friendly service Breakfast is complete and various. Hotel is in a good location , walking distance to sea and shopping area

That was my second stay in this hotel the atmosphere changed and I feel more welcomed. The staff are making more attention to details, I was impressed. Professional team and very good hotel. I will comeback

Tangier is now so generous in terms of hotel accommodation. Still, it is so nice to get back to a place and get even more delighted. We stayed at Royal Tulip during a long week end. We had a business day but decided to stay beyond. The venue had all the amenities from the cozy rooms to the nice spa. The breakfast combines local specials and global touch. The staff is cheerful across the board. If you need help ask for Sara. She can make it happen from speeding up your check-in to recommending the right menu within the hotel. I will certainly recommend Royal Tulip be it for business or for a relaxing weekend with the family.

We were here on a group trip to Morocco. Every aspect of the hotel was excellent. The room was large and very clean. Everything worked very well. Strong WiFi in the room. Meals were very tasty. We ate in both the standard dining room and the vasco restaurant. Staff were competent and friendly. Only two small quibbles. 1. Shower is hard to operate. Once you figure it out, there is plenty of hot water. 2. Lobby has three elevators. They have separate controls so you need to press the buttons for all of them to avoid waiting for a slow elevator.

Yes a Royal hotel. Nice and clean room with balcon and city views. Staff very friendly. Restaurant 1 first floor it’s elegant and service was excellent. The 2 waitresses were very professional and helpful. Breakfast was perfect. Definitely I will be back next year.

Amazed by the staff, they were at the service and very professional, the room was very clean and the breakfast buffet was so good! I had a very good stay with my relatives and we really enjoyed it. I highly recommend this hotel for everyone whose next destination is tangier.

I booked a night in this hotel while traveling from Tarifa to Marrakech and was not disappointed. The hotel staff was very professional and friendly. I injured my foot while out sight seeing and they were very quick to offer to help me to get inside the hotel and to my room. They even brought me an ice pack. The room was very clean (and I am a certified germaphobe), and the breakfast buffet was wonderful. A perfect way to start the day. I hope to make a trip back to Tangier and will surely stay at Royal Tulip City Center.

I work for a truck manufacture and for the last twenty years have organized an incentive trip for our top sales consultants, sales managers, service and parts managers at our independent distributors. It is a consistent and ongoing program and is the best in the industry. Well, the Royal Tulip is right up there with the best. A magnificent hotel that is clean, friendly and state of the art. I am ashamed to say I only speak English and a little German. The staff was very patient and was very helpful going and getting an individual to help us out ordering and making some arrangements. Excellent service and very thoughful of the guests. I would recommend this hotel to all going to Tangier. Also, amazing and wonderful city.

Room is very nice , breakfast is good but service is not ready on time 1 day on 2 (i have done 3 stays of 3 nights in this hotel) , the hotel is not far from the front sea and the center (15 min by walk) , sport room is very good So in average according the price paid

It doesn't have sea view but have very nice locations beside the mall , restaurant, coffees and 5 mints walking to the beach. The gym is well prepared,the breakfast have enough variety and the stuff very very helpful for sure I will come again.

After an exhausting 6hrs drive, I've arrived to the hotel knowing that the Executive room that I have booked was downgraded to business. Why? No idea. I have yet to see with the hotel in the morning. We booked as a couple and received towels for 1 person, 1 bathrobe and all the amenities suitable for a single person (including the room type itself.) Stains are all over the carpet, towels are used up and look quite cheap... Not at all the service I have paid for... The 2 star ratings were for the friendly personnel. Other than that, the hotel is mediocre and not worth the 5 stars. AT ALL.

Wife and I spent a week at the Royal Tulip. There were a few glitches on check-in and we were offered tea and cookies as they were worked out. We opted for the stocked bar, and enjoyed chatting with the bartenders. The room was nice, and had a great view. An easy walk to the train station, the mall, and the modern nightlife area the location was perfect. Waterfront is a few blocks, and restaurants, ice cream and family fare abound. Its a 15 minute taxi to the old city and there are plenty of options for westerners. Highly recommend.

Wonderful hotel and staff. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Quite a luxurious hotel with every amenity you could need. Rooms were very spacious and clean. Nice breakfast in the morning. I would highly recommend.

I have stayed at this hotel for four nights. Location is good especially if one wants to enjoy walking by the newly renovated city center cornish. Staff are reasonably nice although they seem to need more training on hospitality etiquettes. Cleanliness is reasonable except for the corridors which are clearly dirty and filled with food and beverage spills. Restaurants are very poor for such a big hotel although the breakfast is not bad overall.

column3: Modern first-class hotel near Tangier downtown and ferry terminal
column4: On a recent visit to Tangier, my son, daughter, her friend and I stayed at the Royal Tulip City Center. First class experience all-round. Rooms were spacious, modern and comfortable. On-site pool lovely. We dined at on-site restaurant which had an excellent menu catering to all tastes including vegetarian with an modest but OK wine list.

Very nice place neer to down town, fome some of room is posseble to see the sea and hotel pool. Breakfast is good, more swet as salt. The room is big with balcony, big bath room. The service was perfect.

This was a wonderful place from which to navigate our recent holiday in Tangier. Everything functioned as expected. Nice bars and snack stations. Service staff very friendly. Breakfast buffet was outstanding. The most prominent assist was from the head concierge, Mr. Bouayad: he helped in several ways but especially in arranging our two all day outings with a car and driver to Chefchaouan and Asilah. The only downtick is that upon checkout the hotel did not offer us a choice to settle our account in dirham or in USD causing a surcharge of 3% due to their default USD option. By the time we discovered this practice it was a production to reverse and re-enter the transaction in dirham. Aside from this minor annoyance it was an outstanding experience all around. Highly…

I can't say enough good things about Royal Tulip. The staff is wonderful! I am vegetarian and the staff went out of their way to make me a cooked vegetable meal (that was delicious)! The following day they remembered my dietary needs and accommodated me without hesitation. If you speak english (or if you don't) ask for Badr. Badr speaks impeccable english and gave us amazing recommendations of where to visit and eat. I wish we could have taken Badr with us to the rest of the cities we visited in Morocco. Badr made us feel at home and became a smiling face we looked forward to seeing every morning. Thank you to the wonderful staff at the Royal Tulip! We will be back!

This was a highlight of our trip through Morocco. Tangier was our first stop & their staff was amazing, especially Badr (guest relations). He helped us with anything from international SIM cards to local insight. We stayed at El Fenn in Marrakech & Four Seasons in Casablanca, the Royal Tulip staff was on par if not better. We missed our flight with Royal Air Maroc because they had no check in attendant (AVOID ROYAL AIR MAROC) for a 5am flight. The Royal Tulip staff helped us organize a private car to Marrakech, let us go back in our room after check out & sent us food. Stellar!

Royal Tulip was a nice oasis in Tangier. Great fairly spacious modern new rooms with great views. Quiet beautiful large pool. Spa facility was nice surprise. Nice lobby cafe...and hotel restaurant was good too. Breakfast was lavish. ATM in lobby as well. For a Moroccan hotel, this along w the new Hilton, is a top choice for a quick jaunt in Tangier. Clean, friendly, and nicely designed. Bear in mind that once you leave the hotel, hawkers and would-be "I'm not a guide!" guides are all around the main beachfront promenade waiting for tourists to "help" but are then very difficult to shake. We had one who 'happened by' and then wouldn't leave us for 45 minutes - talking endlessly - and escorting us to the market...we had to get rather firm with him 5-6 times saying 'ok goodbye'…

Nice hotel with good breakfast offerings. Lots of good restaurants and a major shopping center outside the hotel doors. Nice to see some English language channels, evening turn down service and small chocolate along with friendly staff.

I liked this hotel for its new facility and modern decoration. The location is excellent for city center and walking distance to the sea and new shopping mall. Hotel price is reasonable and staff very very friendly, especially the reception lady (sorry as I can't recall her name). The point for improvement is the breakfast which was not the expected standard, and staff not really taking care for serving customers during the dining, and instead concentrating on the set up of the empty tables. I think they need more training.

Very nice renovated luxury hotel in the center of tanger. Alternative and pro active staff with spacious clean and beautifull rooms. Great spanish tapes and pool. The place to be when in tanger and not only for business

Beautiful hotel. Clean, comfortable and well located. Friendly and professional staff. Badr at the reception was outgoing and an excellent ambassador. Outstanding food in dining room for dinner and breakfast. Perfect croissants were a delightful surprise. Many services for personal or business stay. Would be happy to stay at this hotel again.

Breakfast is full of choices, room is very clean and even write welcome card with my name. Staff is very friendly. Good location near by the sea and train station! very convenient. The Spanish food is very good. hotel have day travel service with a nice car.

This hotel is situated in a nice position for sight seeing and is close to the beach. The area has been redeveloped since my last visit a few years ago and is now very nice The hotel is beautifully clean, the restaurants are good with nice food although msybe a bit limited, the bars sre nice, with sttentive and helpfull staff. They screen foitball and often have live music. The rooms are nice and have balconies, big bathrooms and sgain, beautifulky clean. I haveto mention the staff. Ì do t think i have ever stayed in a hotel with nicer or more helpfull staff. Noyhing was to much trouble, even when i arrived back very tired from work they arranged hot food for me in the bar, totally unexpected. I think the hitel price is reasonabke cobsidering how well i was treated.

column3: Excellent hotel close to city mall
column4: Very impressive hotel, good and courteous staff, excellent breakfast. Close to eating places like Kentucky and MacDonald etc. Good views from higher floors (4 plus). Even numbers have sea plus pool view and odd numbers have city or big buildings view. Wifi is good except room 817. Dosent work in the room, why know one knows. So if you want wifi in room don't get room close to lifts. (We used cameltrektours.com. For transport to come to this hotel and around Morocco. Had very knowledgable driver Hamid. Contact Moha 00212661821652.).

Beautiful hotel, spacious room and excellent breakfast menu offered. I highly recommend this hotel for its attentive staff and it's great location for both families and business trip. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

Well, what a beautiful Hotel...Brilliant Staff, Spacious rooms, Food was absolutely amazing with so much choice as well as the convenient location which is closed to all city's major access. I recommend this hotel for Business travelers as well as families as it is a relaxing place for a holiday. Really enjoyed my Stay. Thanks,

Tangier offers a wide range of hospitality venues, making it hard for visitors to pick. Royal Tulip has managed to set a great precedence. The hotel is located at the newly developed city. The rooms are meticulously arranged offering all the amenities. The staff is another blessing; they are behind every single nice touch, just name it. A generous breakfast and fabulous view we can get from the 7th floor. One genuine witness towards the staff, they are attentive to the queries. To commend highly is Ms. Sara from the guest department and Ms. Chaimaa at the desk. I saw them in action at a peak situation which they handled with grace.

In the Tangier for the first time visited the hotel. The rooms are nice, great facilities but what is absolutely excellent is guest relations they went above and beyond to accomodate us, in particular Sara. We tried the gusto restaurant and we found it ok.

I visited to Tangier second time and l tried to this hotel. I can say that best hotel in Tangier. Location ,clean rooms,rich breakfast,fast wifi and very very kindly staff. Especially the quest relation Ms. Sara with her beautiful smile:)

Royal tulip is a very nice and comfortable place to stay while in Tangier. Rooms are very spacious and well furnished. Breakfast is very rich. Staff are helpful and hotel has a very nice location near the new waterfront of Tangier

My husband & I wanted a place where we could spend a nice afternoon together. We highly recommend The Royal Tulip (Afternoon tea moment) . We had great time at the hotel. The place is so cosy & beautiful & the staff are welcoming & caring. Our visit was so pleasant. We're looking forward to spending the new year's eve there.

I am a regular visitor to tangier staying at least one week per month for nearly 16 years. I decided that I would try this new Royal Tulip hotel for a change. Great decision! the rooms were perfect, (as a new hotel you don't expect anything else.) But what really surprised me was the standard of service. The service I experienced was first class. From the reception to the porter to the security to the bar and the restaurant, everyone was pleasant, attentive, smiling, and happy to help. I generally do not eat in hotel restaurants however on this occasion I ate in both the Vasco and the Tapas restaurants and the food was really good. I have already book the hotel for my next trip in January.

column3: Modern hotel handy to the railway station
column4: This hotel is literally diagonally across the road from the railway station - the one time we didn't need to hail a cab. The entrance and half of the rooms overlook the railway yards and a building site. There appears to be a lot of new construction happening at that end of town. Our room (803) faced over the yards and was bright, clean and spacious. We didn't use our balcony due to copping smoke from neighbours next door. There are internet terminals on the ground floor opposite the tea salon. We didn't get to use these as they were being hogged by children. Breakfast had all of the usual suspects on the buffet but the highlight were the tiny individual desserts. An indulgent thing to have at that time of the day but small enough to have more than one. Orange juice was a…

This hotel offers it all. The location. A+. The amenities. A+. The staff A+. They do it all and they do it well. As a point to explore all things Tangier this hotel is perfectly situated. The rooms are spacious and clean and the staff diligent.

Had a lovely room with city views which were great as the Hilton next door is not yet open so lots of privacy using the terrace! The beachside rooms are to die for - i took a peek! The staff is very friendly and helpful, particularly the front desk. Lovely tea salon in the lobby and the restaurant El Vasco is fabulous!

Perfect hotel, Perfect service, Very clean & comfortable rooms. Very warm and cosy bar. all the rooms have stunning view. The location is great. The hotel lobby is one of the best i've ever seen. There's also a gym with lots of equipment.

Arrived in Tangier on business, exhausted at the end of my 5th week travel and after another 14 hour day. Turns out I had arrived the day I booked to check out, pre-paid. No problem, they rebooked me immediately in a great room with an ocean view. Dinner in the Spanish restaurant, Vasco, was simply amazing (best hotel restaurant food and service I've ever had!). Right next to Tangier train station and mall with supermarket. And it's super modern and clean and comfortable. Great service, great price, great food. I've even started a TripAdvisor account just to relay how impressed I am.

the best hotel in tangiers just by the beach next to all the shops absolutely fantastic really the best 5 star hotel in tangiers food is to die for and the rooms are beautiful the staff just cant do enough for you fantastic will stay again very soon lovely place to stay

Again I stayed at what I think is the best and finest hotel in tangier in Morocco, Again my room for the ten nights I stayed was 5 stars it was maintained to a high standard by the wonderful maids on the 8th floor The front of house staff are so professional polite and extremely well trained in all aspects of there trade And the customer relations man Mohammed again going out of his way to make everybody's stay at the hotel a stay to remember i recommend this hotel to all who wish to visit tangier whether on business or pleasure And it was my pleasure to write this recomedation

This hotel was chosen by the tour that I had joined. It is within walking distance to the beach. I ate at the breakfast and dinner buffet which was delicious. For example for dinner they had fresh cuts of a variety of fish , chicken, beef that they cook before you. Numerous selections to choose from. Fresh, tasty salads, wide variety of fresh fruits and cakes, fresh bread. Breakfast was also delightful with a chef making omelets for you. Again a variety to choose from. Staff are very helpful and attentive. There is a swimming pool and spa

This hotel is absolutely fantastic. The accommodations, service and location. Note, it says it's in the city center but that's a matter of perspective. For us, as tourists, it didn't seem like the stereotypical Moroccan city center with people wheeling and dealing at your doorstep. It's actually in a very nice area with large buildings and hotels a short cab ride away from the touristic "city center" with the exotic chaos you would imagine and perhaps crave as you heard to Tangier. The hotel and its staff are extremely welcoming. Don't miss the tea and snacks in the lobby! So tasty! And the hotel breakfast is another don't miss. The food is very authentic (in my American foodie opinion). The selection is vast an tasty. The cab ride to the Medina should only cost you about 10…

Eons ahead in quality and standard from the other sub brands under the Tulip umbrella brand. One of the best hotels I have stayed at. Totally modern with most amenities and immaculate attention to detail. Cleanliness and service were superlative too, as was the food, the pool area and other common areas. At the poolside you could enjoy a lavish dinner spread, live singing and music, sheesha (hubbly-bubbly), or keep abreast with live Euro Cup Football ! Equally comfortable were the beds, and a well equipped toilet. Of course commonly needed add-ons like a kettle, iron and ironing table, fridge etc. were provided in mint condition. In short would never stay anywhere else in Tangier if I ever visited this city again.

Beautiful and comfortable rooms. Great service and really kind people... We checked out many of the 5 stars but this one really had the best room. Pool is well taken care of and all of the areas are comfortable to sit and relax.

column3: Recommendable hotel while on business: Good quality rooms & excellent breakfast
column4: Stayed in the hotel during a business trip. Rooms are large and clean with a big bathroom including bath tub. Breakfast includes a large buffet with plenty of options like fruits, yogurt, bread and egg. Overall, a place to recommend while on business.

I have stay at the Royal tulip three times this year and I must say each visit has been a great experience The front of house staff the lob staff and basically all the staff at the hotel give 100% to the customer nothing is too much for them The rooms are of a high standard 5star The upkeep of the hotel is fantastic I have had need of some services while in the hotel and the man of the hour was Mohammed MKAOURI the guest relations front of house Who went out of his way to do everything I asked of him many thanks Mohammed your a star I give the Royal tulip 10 out of 10 Great place to stay

column3: A very good hotel near the sea
column4: I spent 2 nights in this very nice hotel. The room was large and I even had a sea view as the hotel is not far from the sea. Room service was fast and breakfast plentiful. In the bar they have some big screen TVs and good local beer. The airconditioning was the best I have experienced so far - noiseless and very effective! The Wifi was, on the other hand, sometimes really slow or non-existent.

We loved staying here. We took the overnight train from Marrakech and arrived at the hotel at 8:00 AM and they let us check in early! which was great since we really wanted to rest and shower. The room was so clean and comfortable. The staff proved to be very nice and helpful. Shout out to Abdessamie Bouayad, the concierge who was amazing and so attentive. They provided suggestions for things for us to do and got us a tour guide to take us around. They even called us later to ask if things were ok. The place is neat with the restaurants they have located at the hotel which include a tapas restaurant, a cigar bar, a coffee and tea café, and another restaurant for breakfast and lunch. Located nearby are more restaurants and right next to the hotel is a shopping mall. If…

I stayed at the Royal tulip for one right when I was touring around Morocco. The location is perfect, as it's a few minutes from the beach and a few minutes from the tangier night life. There are plenty of restaurants and activities around. The staff were very helpful, and I would definitely stay there again.

Very confortable and clean hotel. It is new. Boufet restaurant is excellent to have breakfast and dinner as well. Rooms are big and clean and furniture is very new. Service is kind and friendly. Nice swimming pool. Other restaurants available.

Every couple of months we like to go away on a 1 or 2 night break Last weekend we went to Tangier and stayed at the Royal Tulip Hotel We booked a deluxe room with sea views and it was perfect. We had fresh fruit and pastries delivered to our room, complimentary we also dined at he Basque Restaurant in the hotel again faultless we could have been anywhere in the world. The hotel was super clean the rooms were massive with a wide range of toiletries as well as bath robes hair dryer safe and all the amenities you can think of a 5* hotel should have. The concierge was very helpful and moving around the city was very easy taxis are just outside the hotel gates.

stayed there for one night. single room but it was extremely spacious. huge comfortable bathroom. they brought to my room welcoming sweets ( 3 plates with different assortments ). wi fi connection in reception and rooms. viber call from room as well. there was a trivial leaking problem in bathroom but was able to fix myself ( just tightening the spiral ). rich buffet for breakfast and evening. very polite and helpful staff. located next to shopping centre ( almost adjacent ). mall has mostly western brands, no gift shop, acima supermarket, cinemas.

Checked into the hotel late and found the rooms to be clean and well set out. Chefs waited agreed to cook for us, even if it was later than the restaurant closing hour. Had a drink in the Tapas bar which was nice. Downstairs bar is very smokey. My only complaint would be the breakfast. It was difficult to get served coffee. Seemed to not have enough staff.

It was a hotel very cool, very good, and I spent a great time, and all the staff a high degree of good handling and sophistication, and the breakfast was also very good and varied and comprehensive I've had a really enjoyable and I've seen a new mall near the hotel, but unfortunately still under processing. And it will have a big affair.

Stayed in a few different hotels in Tangier and this one is very good for the price. It's near to the sea front and there are a lot of restaurants near by. The rooms are clean and we'll maintained but then it has been recently built. The rooms are nice and a good size also near to the train station and next door to a shopping centre.

This yung man work in this hotel as a receptionist is really special because I have 15 hotel in the US and familyar with the excellent treatment but this man show me the best of all taybe of warm nice and friendly reception and services I injoy my time in this hotel because of him and recommended him as the best receptionist for this month in Morocco Dr Hassan

All of the staff were professional and very helpful especially miss Meryem at the front desk who made our stay even better . the decor of the whole hotel is very modern. The rooms were spacious, clean and cosy with tea and coffee making facilities . The breakfast was plentiful and delicious. Thanks to all the team for this lovely stay.

I checked in for one night , I was welcomed by the sweet Meriem at the front desk who went through the check in procedure smoothly. My requests of high floor as well as non smoking room were taken into consideration. The room was clean, spacious and the had beautiful view facing both city and beach. I will definitely come back to this property !

Very Professional staff Very clean rooms Very delicious breakfast This is my fourth time in this hotel and I'm always satisfied with the service. But tough competition is coming nearby - Hilton garden inn - Be careful, keep the service up and the prices stable

column3: The hotel to stay in Tangier
column4: Surrounded by luxury and well trained , gentle staff , you can relax and enjoy all that this hotel has to offer If you happen to meet the manager you'll understand why the staff is so efficient, good looking and friendly

when i go Tangier i stay here for two night. when i entered here i greeted by a good person. stay here im feeling very good and comfortable ats really looking like far from home as a home. all staff are very good by service. thsnks kenza.

column3: A very nice place to come back to after a long day of siteseeing in Tangier !
column4: We only stayed one night but when we arrived without a reservation we where greeted by a nice man named Hussain who made sure we received a nice room at good price. We where introduced to the concierge and given our room key. Our room was clean and spacious with comfortable beds ! Much to our surprise Hussain called our room to make sure that we had everything we need and where happy. We had the breakfast buffet the next morning which was amazing with fresh juices and fruit and omelettes made to order. I would definitely recommend this hotel when visiting Tangier.

column3: I can say ok as a Luxury Hotel
column4: That place is well situated in the city, you can have a wonderful time enjoying the view and the souks( Local Markets) around the place. Regarding the hotel I noticed that they need to renovate some section in there. All is good .

This new hotel near the train station in Tanger is the new standard in Tanger I hope. Friendly staff, clean rooms and professional management. Nice restaurants. A good place too be for the professional travellers. I will come back

2nd time stayed there. Rooms are nice. Overall hotel is good. Booked for dinner at the Spanish restaurant (mezzanine level ) with family. 2 Spanish men just decided they can smoke in the restaurant. No one talked to them. They don't even have an ashtray on the table. When I complained, the front desk night shift said he will post a complaint, but he did not. The front desk lady in the morning did say "Oh you know, don't be hypocrite, everybody smokes in the hotel everywhere, there is nothing to complain about" !!!!!!!!!! Astonishing !!

Stayed one night as part of a tour and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of the hotel and rooms. Buffet dinner was excellent including a wok station,grill station with different types of fish and meats. Desserts included a chocolate fountain. Taxi to the medina was 16 euros round trip.

Comfy rooms Good wifi connection Central to all local ammentities Friendly and attentive staff who cannot do enough. Even purchased resources required from outside the hotel. The hotel is clean and the facilities are varied. Good value for money and a real morro can feel would recommend to all

For a hotel that boast about being the place for business men to go, I was very disappointed. 1- they have no adapters, I couldnt charge my laptop nor work 2- they cannot provide an iron and ironing board before 9am - really?? What about people who need to be in meetings by that time? Thanks. 3- room aminities are bad quality. The shampoo was so watery i felt they were adding water to fill up used bottles 4- breakfast buffet: i literally struggled to find something to eat. No healthy options except eggs. Cereal containers look so dirty it made me wonder when was the last time someone washed them. 5-website said there is a fitness center, got there and the fitness center is not even open yet. The staff are very friendly but sometimes thats not enough to have a good stay. …

column3: Excellent manager doing what needs to be done
column4: When i checked in, I paid through hotels.com. The booking hadn't come in yet. One man sits to the right was very hostile and aggressive to me. He checked and said it wasn't there. Then he said he found it but when i gave him my card he charged it for 2 nights. I was shocked, i already paid. I told him this several times but he didnt believe me. He started muttering under his breath in arabic. Then he looked at me and said "I guarantee you did not pay". WHAT? How do you know what i did? I replied, "I guarantee I did" he said "No I guarantee you didn't" he said "show me reciept. this is supposedly a 5 star hotel. He needs to be fired. I went up double charged and found the receipt online. I showed him. He muttered in arabic then said, "its sunday maybe tomorrow. Ok tomorrow if…

We had a great stay in Golden Tulip. The staff is very nice and helpful. The food was delicious and the rooms were perfect ! The hotel was full but it wasn't noisy and the bed is VERY comfortable ~ we loved our stay there! It is the best hotel in Tangier so far !

Passing an internship at the Royal Tulip City Center hotel was an eye opening experience for me. I passed it in the Sales and Marketing department with four, amazing staff members; Hamza Boulaich - Sales executive; Soumaya-Reservation Manager; Zainab-Senior Sales; Aicha - Sales Director. These people taught me so much about Sales, how the hotel functions, how reservations are taken care of, how to deal with customers etc. They demonstrated a strong and great work ethic that resulted from reliability, dedication, productivity, and cooperation. Not only were they great at work, but they were the nicest people. It is very important to go to work and feel loved by your co-workers and that's what these people made me feel like. They were always ready to help with huge smiles on their…

My stay in the Royal Tulip City Center Tanger was a remarkable experience regarding the level of services, cleanness, room size, sleep quality, quality of furniture and the most important thing is the smiley faces around you regardless how demanding you are and I would like take this opportunity to send special greeting to madam Rajaa working in the front desk for her sweetness and her professionalism wishing her and all the hotel personnel all the best.

It's no secret that I keep coming to the same hotel ! Everything from beginning to the end has been more than perfect ! All the staff are very courteous and specially Hind Chiadli and Yassine Temsamani !! The hotel is impeccable and the food outstanding !! The hotel was completely booked and busy and I felt like I was the only guest getting 100 % of the staff's attention ! They make you feel very special at Royal Tulip Center ! I would definitely recommend this hotel to everybody I know ! Summary : Staff : 5 stars Cleanliness : 5 stars Food : 5 stars Pricing : 5 stars Overall : 5 stars .. PS: I would give 10 stars !!! See you soon Royal Tulip Center of Tangier !!

Stayed in this hotel for one night, as the previous place that we were booked into was horrible. We were extremely tired from our holiday and wanted to just rest. The location itself was not great, but the Hotel more than made up for that. We ordered a twin room, and each of the beds were queen size. They are possibly the best hotel beds I have ever slept on. We were so tired, so ordered room service. The food was amazing, and they gave us extra treats which was an added bonus. The bathrobes was so soft, you did not want to get out of them.

Overall a very fine experience. My granddaughter and I had just two half days and a full day. To have the best experiences I sent several emails to arrange tours/guides in advance, including airport pickup. All went well, The concierge was very helpful. There was one small disagreement about an additional charge for extra guide time and car use, but it was resolved quickly by the concierge, Sammie.The hotel is new and accommodations are excellent. One of our two nights at the hotel was Sunday, during Ramadan. The restaurant was closed on Sundays during Ramadan,leaving o no usual option for eating in the hotel. But all was well because one of the front desk staff suggested we join the locals at iftar, the feast breaking the fast at sundown. Thus, we had a new, interesting and…

The hotel looks nice because it is newly built and the food is nice. But the service we have received is appauling which is why I have given this hotel the worst rating. The problems we have encountered include the following-out of our 6 day stay we had poor room service on 4 days On the first day we got no clean towels. Second day no tea, coffee or clean towels third day no tea coffee or toilet paper. 4th day despite going out for several hours our room was left un- serviced. I have received better service at 3 star hotels. They also advertise a spa at this hotel which doesn't exist. They advised us they would arrange for transport to take us to their sister hotel golden tulip to have a spa day. We had a driver take us their but on the way back the concierge ordered a taxi.…

New 5* hotel in Tangier, good service, nice and comfortable rooms. I had lunch in the Spanish restaurant and the menu is really interesting, the dessert are the best. Just the sea view is missing but perfect when going in Tangier for business.

Awful - and I've never used that word before on here. And sadly I chose this hotel because of its Tripadvisor reviews. So I need to say these two things first: 1. Look at my reviews on here. I've written quite a few. I always try to be positive. 2. I came to this hotel during Ramadan. That's significant but shouldn't excuse anything. Remember, hotels have a choice whether to open and serve customers just as we have a choice to give them our money. So the single positive thing: My room was modern, well equipped, spotlessly clean and spacious. It had tea/coffee making facilities and two free bottles of mineral water. Thank goodness for the coffee and the water, as you will see. The negatives, in chronological order: 1. Poor reception service on arrival - it took 40…

Had a great stay at this hotel. It wasn't too full therefore plenty of room for us. The pool was totally dedicated to one person. Very clean. Breakfast was included and excellent. Would definitely recommend if you don't want to be located near the old part of town. Taxis are affordable so not an issue getting there. 5 stars.

column3: Royal Tulip is an exelent choice for good food good service and good staff
column4: I have been to Tanger six times since October 2014 and I literally watched them build this great place. If you like value with genuine and professional service Royal Tulip on Malabata is the place for you I would give it a sixth star since the price is so very reasonable: Breakfast buffet included and worth 150 dirims alone and then dinner buffet, whew the other night I had wonderfully fresh sword fish and chicken kabob and cafe au let and awesome truly great deserts. I am single and a freelance journalist and sometimes suffer from writer's block and the friendliness of the staff specially Mohamed and Fatiha and the sales executive hamza puts me at great ease and I write all night long! Thankyou Royal Tulip.. thanks John , Boston, mass USA

Stayed for one night at this hotel and really loved it, would definitely stay there again should I be in Tangier. The surrounding area leaves a lot to be desired and it was a pleasure to have a long hot bath, get into the plush bathrobe, order room service and just chilling. Very spacious hotel room, beautifully presented. The twin beds were queens, wonderful linen and an excellent night's sleep.

We stayed one day/night at the Royal Tulip. Upon check-in we had the pleasure of meeting the Chef Concierge (Mourad Boulmane). He was eager to ensure we had a great experience during our first trip to Morocco. My girlfriend was not feeling well as we arrived in Morocco and he offered to assist in getting medications for us at a local Pharmacy. Mourad provided exceptional customer service that seems to be a rare find these days. The hotel is new, thus very clean and nice. Mourad recommended we try the buffett as we were hungry upon arrival, and the food and the whole staff were exceptional and very friendly. It's this type of service that will keep us coming back. Next time we are in Morocco, we will definitely stay here and look forward to being greeted by Mourad and his…

We had a most unfortunate experience trying to get to Tangier. All ferries from Tarifa were cancelled due to weather. We had a tight timeline and strong interest to get to Morocco so attempted the ferry from Algeciras. There had been no ferries for over a day so we were not prepared for what waited for us. What does this have to do with Royal Tulip? Well we were not going to be able to cancel with 24 hour notice but they were so wonderful to manage my circumstance, no penalty. They had arranged a ride from the feet which also had to be cancelled. Then it looked like we would get a ferry so I needed to re-book the room and arrange a ride from a ferry terminal much farther away. Again the Royal Tulip came through and managed to re-book me!! Then there was delays of…

column3: nice clean room with very nice view
column4: I stayed 6 nights in this Amazing new hotel and i was feeling so comfortable because it was super clean and safe and most important is the staff who work there they are super friendly and ready to help any time day or night , one of the staff his name is Hamza he was very friendly and he help us organize a road trip to shefchawen and he made sure that a good driver will take us there . I think we wore very luck that he helped us . Overall i hardly recommend this hotel

column3: We made it in the end
column4: After staying in two other places in tangier the Royal Tulip is by far the best experience, beautiful views from the balcony to friendly staff faces, one staff member who really who made our stay most welcome was Hamza, he was a true gentleman and made us feel at home. this is defiantly the place to stay, and because of that I will be returning to the Royal Tulip.

Amazing place great food super clean rooms .friendly staff specialy one member of the staff his name is Hamza and he is the sales executive he made our stay a pleasant one.i was supposed to stay for 2nights but I decided to prolong the stay because it felt like home. I definitely will be back to the Royal tulip .

We stayed a night in the Royal Tulip Hotel during their "soft" opening. The hotel had only been open for 10 days but it was really a lovely hotel. The staff are obviously really wanting their hotel to succeed and are extremely helpful and friendly. From the time you walk through the door and are greeted with a platter of hand towels laying on rose petals, to reception and into the restaurant, you feel welcome. The decor is extremely modern and fresh.
